meanings.definition: To use up or consume resources
meanings.sent1: She was expending all her energy on the project.
meanings.sent2: The company is expending its budget on marketing strategies.
meanings.sent3: After expending all his supplies, he had to find more.
meanings.sent4: The wildfire was expending its fury across the forest.
meanings.sent5: The hungry caterpillar was expending its energy crawling up the tree.

meanings.sent1: They were expending their savings on a new car.
meanings.sent2: The government is expending funds on infrastructure development.
meanings.sent3: Expending money on unnecessary items can lead to financial trouble.
meanings.sent4: Her shopping spree was expending her wallet faster than expected.
meanings.sent5: The charity was expending donations to help those in need.

meanings.definition: To put forth effort or energy
meanings.sent1: He was expending all his strength to lift the heavy box.
meanings.sent2: Students are expending their focus on studying for exams.
meanings.sent3: Expending effort in practice will lead to improvement in skills.
meanings.sent4: The athlete was expending his determination to reach the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The team was expending their teamwork to win the championship.
